ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] Great help and encouragement/newbies
ygData.msgSnippet: ROFL!! And how many screen shots did you take :) ... Having played EQ, Asheron s Call and Dark Age of Camelot I will say that EQ has the highest learning curve
ygData.messageBody:
ROFL!!

And how many screen shots did you take :)

> On time my video card blew. I had to use the on-board video
> from my main
> board. Needless to say, the graphics capability lacked a lot.
> My character
> is a Val Shir. The main board video chip wasn't capable of
> handling the
> polygons for clothing. All of the female kitty dancers at the
> campfire in
> Thicket were completely nude. I sat down in from to the white
> tigress for
> about 10 minutes and watched her dance. The dances were short
> but very
> entertaining.
>

Having played EQ, Asheron's Call and Dark Age of Camelot I will say that EQ
has the highest learning curve of them all, at least for me. Part of it is
the ever-changing aspect of the game. I have a play-guide from 1998 and
some of the stuff in it is flat out wrong now. I keep finding info on
websites that does not work. I do not recall having those problems with AC,
and DAOC is to new to be that changed.
